* Abstract base class for all commands.
* Each command must implement the execute method.
* @param ui       the UI object for interaction
* @param storage  the storage object for saving tasks
* @throws AbangException if the command cannot be executed
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, UI ui, Storage storage) throws AbangException;
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Creates a DeleteCommand with the given input array.
* @param inputArray the parsed user input split into words
* Executes the delete command by removing the specified task
* from the task list and saving the updated list to storage.
* @param ui       the UI object for interaction
* @param storage  the storage object for saving tasks
* @throws AbangException if the task index is invalid
public void execute(TaskList taskList, UI ui, Storage storage) throws AbangException {
throw new AbangException("Please key in valid number");
System.out.println(String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", numTask));
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Executes the exit command by printing a goodbye message
* @param ui       the UI object for interaction
* @param storage  the storage object for saving tasks
public void execute(TaskList taskList, UI ui, Storage storage) throws AbangException{
System.out.println("Thank you and have a good day!");
* Represents a command to find tasks containing a given keyword.
* Creates a FindCommand with the given input array.
* @param inputArray the parsed user input split into words
* Executes the find command by searching the task list for tasks
* that contain the given keyword and printing the results.
* @param ui       the UI object for interaction
* @param storage  the storage object for saving tasks
* @throws AbangException if no keyword is provided
public void execute(TaskList taskList, UI ui, Storage storage) throws AbangException {
throw new AbangException("Please provide a keyword to find.");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task list.
* Executes the list command by printing all tasks in the task list.
* @param ui       the UI object for interaction
* @param storage  the storage object for saving tasks
public void execute(TaskList taskList, UI ui, Storage storage) throws AbangException{
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* Creates a MarkCommand with the given input array.
* @param inputArray the parsed user input split into words
* Executes the mark command by marking the specified task as done
* and saving the updated task list to storage.
* @param ui       the UI object for interaction
* @param storage  the storage object for saving tasks
* @throws AbangException if the task index is invalid
public void execute(TaskList taskList, UI ui, Storage storage) throws AbangException{
throw new AbangException("Please provide a task number to mark");
throw new AbangException("Please key in a valid number");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");

* Handles persistence of the task list to/from disk.
* This implementation reads/writes a single text file at data/Abang.txt.
* Creates a storage object and ensures the backing file exists.
* If the parent directory/file does not exist, they will be created.
* Loads tasks from the backing file and returns them as a {@link TaskList}.
* Lines that cannot be read will be ignored, and a warning is printed.
* Saves the given lines to the backing file, one line per task.
* Represents a deadline task with a description and a specific deadline.
* The deadline may be stored as either a LocalDate, a LocalDateTime,
* or as a free-text detail string if parsing fails.
* Creates a Deadline task with the given description and detail.
* The detail string is first attempted to be parsed as a date (d/M/yyyy).
* If that fails, it is attempted to be parsed as a date and time (d/M/yyyy HHmm).
* If both parsing attempts fail, the detail is stored as a free-text string.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param detail      the deadline detail as a string
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task,
* @return the string representation of the deadline task
* Returns the file format representation of this deadline task,
* which is used for saving the task to persistent storage.
* @return the deadline task as a string suitable for file saving
* Represents a event task with a description and a specific start and end.
* The start and end may be stored as either a LocalDate, a LocalDateTime,
* or as a free-text detail string if parsing fails.
DateTimeFormatter fmtDateTime = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter PARSE_DATE = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy");
private static final DateTimeFormatter PARSE_DATETIME = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
* Creates a Event task with the given description and detail.
* The start string is first attempted to be parsed as a date (d/M/yyyy).
* If that fails, it is attempted to be parsed as a date and time (d/M/yyyy HHmm).
* If both parsing attempts fail, the detail is stored as a free-text string.
* The end string is parsed in the same way
* @param description the description of the task
* @param start    the start detail as a string
* @param end      the end detail as a string
public Event(String description, String start, String end) {
* Returns a string representation of this event task,
* including the formatted start and end times.
* @return the string representation of the event task
* Returns the file format representation of this event task,
* used for saving to persistent storage.
* @return the event task as a string suitable for file saving
* Represents a simple todo task with only a description.
* Creates a ToDo task with the given description.
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns a string representation of this todo task.
* @return the string representation of the todo task
* Returns the file format representation of this todo task,
* used for saving to persistent storage.
* @return the todo task as a string suitable for file saving
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon.");
